nl.naturalis.oaipmh.api

Interface IOAIRepository


  • public interface IOAIRepository
    Life-cycle interface defining the capacities of an OAI repository. This is the only interface that OAI repositories must implement, although they can optionally implement a few other interfaces (e.g. IResumptionTokenParser). For each OAI-PMH request the REST layer cycles through the following calls against the repository:
    1. If it is one of the ListXXX requests (e.g. ListRecords), call getResumptionTokenParser() to decompose the resumption token into its constituent parts.
    2. Call one of the six protocol request implementations (depending on the value of the verb argument).
    3. If it is one of the ListXXX requests, call #getResumptionTokenWriter() to generate a resumption token for the next request.
    4. Call getErrors() to generate the <error> elements.
    Besides implementing the interface methods, OAI repository implementations must have a no-arg constructor.
    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

    • Method Detail

      • getResumptionTokenParser

        IResumptionTokenParser getResumptionTokenParser()
        Provide a resumption token reader. Used to decompose a resumption token into its constituent parts. Implementations may return null, in which case the default parser is used.
        Returns:

      • getErrors

        List<OAIPMHerrorType> getErrors()
        Return OAI-PMH specific errors. Implementations may return null or an empty list to indicate that there were no errors. Returning a non-empty list while also return a non-null response for the applicable protocol request is also allowed.
        Returns:
